wikipedia_page.main: Robert John Babington, DSC, QC (9 April 1920 – 17 September 2010) was an Ulster Unionist Party politician, who served as the member of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland for North Down from 1969 to 1972, and a county court judge. He was born in Dublin.

response: *Robert Babington, Ulster Unionist politician and judge

link_mentions.page: List of members of the 12th House of Commons of Northern Ireland

response: Babington was born into the Anglo-Irish Babington family that arrived in Ireland in 1610 when Brutus Babington was appointed Bishop of Derry. Notable relations include Robert Babington, William Babington, Benjamin Guy Babington and James Melville Babington and author Anthony Babington.
*Robert Babington, 90, British politician, member of the House of Commons of Northern Ireland for North Down (1969–1972).

Robert Babington (1402-1464), another son of Sir William Babington, married Maulde Venour. His son William Babington (born circa 1442) was Warden of the Fleet Prison and Keeper of the Royal Palace of Westminster, both posts were successively held by this branch of the Babingtons.Ancient tenures of land, and jocular customs of manors by Thomas Blount

Rev Hume Babington's fifth son was David Robert Babington (1852-1902) who had six children with Mary Le Fanu. David Robert Babington (1852-1902), through his son Major David Babington (1887-1963), was the grandfather of Robert Babington, Member of Parliament for North Down in the Northern Ireland Parliament from 1969-1972 and a recipient of the Distinguished Service Cross
* Robert Babington (1920–2010), Northern Ireland politician, barrister and judge

Babington was born in County Cork in 1920 to Oscar John Gilmore Babington (1879–1930), also an Army officer, and his wife Annie Honor Wrixon (1878–1975).Ireland, Civil Registration Marriages Index, 1845–1958, vol 5, pg 63 Among his cousins were Sir Anthony Babington and Robert Babington, a recipient of the Distinguished Service Cross.Who's Who 1991, p. 72An Uncertain Voyage by BABINGTON, ANTHONY, published by Barry Rose Law Publishers Limited 15 June 2000,
*David Robert Babington (17 August 1852 – 17 May 1902), solicitor, married Mary Le Fanu on 12 November 1878 (grandfather of Robert Babington)
